name: Francis Crimmins
tagline: I am a senior software engineer that specialises in combining ideas from the research and open source worlds to create new products and systems.
body:
## Summary
I have designed and developed a 100 million page web crawler, recommender systems, a program for detecting "spikes" and related queries in search engine logs and a text miner for definitions from web pages.

I am currently a Senior Software Engineer at [Funnelback](http://funnelback.com/) in Canberra, and prior to that was a Research Engineer at Australia's national research agency, the [CSIRO](http://csiro.au/).

## Portfolio

### Recommender Systems
Example of recommended "similar items" overlaid over a StackOverflow question:

![StackoverFlow Recommender Screenshot](../images/stackoverflow-similar-items.png)

I designed and implemented an algorithm which combines information from multiple sources, such as "co-clicks", "related clicks", "related results" etc. For more details, please see the [Funnelback Recommender System Documentation](http://docs.funnelback.com/recommendations.html).

### Query Spikes and Related Queries

![Query spikes and related queries screenshot](../images/query-spikes-and-related-queries.png)

I was the original designer of the Funnelback "Pattern Analyser" system. This can detect "[spikes](http://docs.funnelback.com/pattern_analyser_reports.html)" in queries in the query log time series data, where these spikes are usually due to some external temporal event. I also designed and implemented a system to automatically detect related queries, based on their click patterns. This can be used to group queries which have no terms in common but have the same semantics.

### Web Crawling and Graph Analysis
Example visualization of a web crawl:

![Graph visualisation](../images/website-graph.png)

I was the original designer and developer of the Funnelback web crawler, which was designed to minimise resource usage (memory, storage etc.) while crawling 100s of millions of web pages. I have also done work on analysing crawl link graphs and how "annotations" like queries, clicks and anchortext can be used to enrich the dataset for other applications (including Analytics and Data Mining).

### Text Mining
Example of extraction of definitions from text:

![Graph visualisation](../images/text-mining-example.png)

I am the creator of a "[text mining](http://docs.funnelback.com/text_mining.html)" system which uses syntactic patterns to extract definitions for phrases and acronyms. When those terms are used as a query the definition can be displayed at the top of the search results, with a link back to the original page.

## Key Skills
* Information Retrieval & Search
* Data Mining
* Analytics
* Distributed Systems
* NoSQL
* Relational Databases
* API Design
* Java

## Education
* M.Sc. in Information Retrieval, [Dublin City University](http://dcu.ie/computing/index.shtml) (1996 - 1998)
* B.Sc. in Computer Applications, Dublin City University (1992 - 1996)
